New Records: Dawid Malan became the oldest Englishman to score a World Cup hundred.
Joe Root surpassed Graham Gooch as England's leading run-scorer in World Cups.
Key Match Events: Dawid Malan hit 140 as England piled up 364 before Reece Topley ripped through Bangladesh's top order to set up a comfortable win.
Litton Das and Mushfiqur Rahim produced half-centuries, but their partnership of 72 at close to a run a ball only succeeded in adding some respectability to the scorecard.
Reece Topley struck with his fourth, fifth and 16th balls to leave Bangladesh tottering on 26 for 3.
Pre-Game Insights: England showed an appetite for the climb, and Dawid Malan and Jonny Bairstow set off at a steady canter in recording their first century stand as openers.
Post-Match Reflections: The margin of victory was a comfort to England, whose standing and confidence had taken a dent following their thumping in Ahmedabad.
Bangladesh were fined 5% of their match fee for being one over behind the required over rate against England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England maintained their winning momentum after their opening World Cup match defeat.
Dawid Malan's imperious form has seen him go from spare part to first pick in a matter of months.
Others: Bangladesh's death-bowling smarts, Shoriful Islam and Mahedi Hasan, claimed regular wickets.
England's bowlers got a thorough workout, such was their level of comfort, there was barely any need to worry about the state of the outfield as the World Cup-holders avoided being tripped up again.
